item.title: Spill, the Black-owned Twitter alternative, scores investment from Kerry Washington
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
as the second anniversary of Spill rolls around, Spill has something else to celebrate: Emmy-winning actress Kerry Washington has made an investment in his app.

item.title: Why is ChatGPT so bad at math?
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
You might've noticed that ChatGPT — and AI in general — isn't good at math. There's a reason, and it has to do with how modern AI is built.

item.title: This device charger has Apple’s Find My tech built in
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
PlugBug starts at $70 and has earned the title of "first USB-C charger that includes Find My.”

item.title: The lawmaker behind California’s vetoed AI bill, SB 1047, has harsh words for Silicon Valley
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
The lawmaker behind California’s recently vetoed AI bill, SB 1047, is going down swinging. For months, Silicon Valley debated whether SB 1047 would have a chilling effect on California’s AI boom or would protect against catastrophic harms from advanced AI systems. The answer never became clear, since California governor Gavin Newsom decided it was the […]

item.title: TuSimple founder Xiaodi Hou is back with a new autonomous truck startup
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
Two years ago, Xiaodi Hou was ousted from his position as CEO of TuSimple, an autonomous trucking startup he co-founded that has since shut down U.S. operations and delisted from the stock exchange — and, in an odd twist, the company has pivoted to AI animation and gaming in China.  Now Hou is back with […]

item.title: Toyota pours another $500M into electric air taxi startup Joby Aviation
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description:
Toyota is doubling down on Joby Aviation with a $500 million investment into the California-based company that’s developing electric air taxis. Toyota’s total investment in Joby, which includes a $394 million capital injection back in 2020, is now $894 million. The funds will be used to help Joby complete the lengthy Type 2 certification process […]

item.title: Meat replacement startup Heura has a new mission to slay junk food with healthier plant-based swaps
item.dc:creator: Natasha Lomas
item.description:
The offices of plant-based protein startup Heura are tucked away down a narrow street a short distance from one of Barcelona’s main tourist draws. But the team of entrepreneurs and food scientists won’t be remixing their protein cocktails in close proximity to La Sagrada Família for much longer — they’re moving to new, larger digs […]

item.title: EU’s DSA enforcers send more questions to Snapchat, TikTok and YouTube about AI risks
item.dc:creator: Natasha Lomas
item.description:
On Wednesday, the European Union requested more information from Snapchat, TikTok and YouTube about their respective algorithms for content recommendation, activity that falls under the bloc’s online governance rulebook, the Digital Services Act (DSA). In a press release the Commission said it’s sent requests for information (RFI) to the three social media platforms asking them […]

item.title: Hedosophia leads $7M seed round into retail supply chain AI startup Ameba
item.dc:creator: Mike Butcher
item.description:
Ameba takes the unstructured data in a retailer’s supply chain systems, sprinkles in some generative AI, and makes the whole thing more efficient.

item.title: Motier Ventures unveils La Maison, a community space for the French tech ecosystem
item.dc:creator: Romain Dillet
item.description:
On Tuesday evening local time, Motier Ventures, an early stage tech investment firm based in Paris, unveiled a startup hub called La Maison. This relatively new investor in the French tech ecosystem is the family office of the Houzé family — the owners of upmarket fashion retailer the Galeries Lafayette Group. As the Galeries Lafayette […]

item.title: Peak XV trims fund size and fees as Indian market overheats
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
Peak XV, the largest India and Southeast Asia-focused venture firm, is reducing the size of a handful of its funds and lowering fees as it seeks to become “deeply aligned” with its limited partners. The firm, which secured capital commitments totaling $2.85 billion in mid 2022, informed its backers on Tuesday evening that it is […]

item.title: Palmer Luckey: Every country needs a ‘warrior class’ excited to enact ‘violence on others in pursuit of good aims’

Palmer Luckey raged against America’s adversaries, endorsed completely autonomous weapons, and hinted at an Anduril IPO.

item.title: Impulse Space bets on shuttling satellites between orbits, raises $150M to scale up
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description:
Impulse Space has raised a massive new tranche of funding as big-name investors bet that moving satellites around in orbit will soon be a high demand service.  The startup, which was founded by Tom Mueller three years ago, announced the $150 million Series B round on Tuesday. Impulse is developing a line of orbital transfer […]

A complete list of all the known layoffs in tech, from Big Tech to startups, broken down by month throughout 2024.

item.title: A hidden microphone on a San Francisco street pole is spotting ‘bops’ in the wild
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
In San Francisco’s Mission district, good music is all around you. That’s why, high up on a street pole at an undisclosed location in the Mission, Riley Walz installed a solar-powered box containing an old Android phone running the song identifying service, Shazam, 24 hours a day, seven days a week. The so called “Bop […]

item.title: Threads users can now see who follows them from other fediverse servers
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
Instagram head Adam Mosseri announced on Tuesday that users who have connected their accounts to the fediverse, also known as the open social web, can now see who follows them and likes their posts from other fediverse servers, such as Mastodon and Pixelfed.  The company said users will now have up to 15 minutes to make […]

item.title: Anthropic hires OpenAI co-founder Durk Kingma
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Durk Kingma, one of the lesser-known co-founders of OpenAI, today announced that he’ll be joining Anthropic. In a series of posts on X, Kingma revealed that he’ll be working mostly remotely, from the Netherlands (where he’s based), but didn’t say which Anthropic org he’ll be joining — or leading. Reached for comment, an Anthropic spokesperson […]

item.title: Direct ocean capture may be the next frontier for carbon removal
item.dc:creator: Mike Butcher
item.description:
Amsterdam-based Brineworks, a company specializing in seawater electrolysis technology, says its innovative method is expected to cost under $100 per ton of CO2 at scale.

item.title: OpenAI’s DevDay brings Realtime API and other treats for AI app developers
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
It’s been a tumultuous week for OpenAI, full of executive departures and major fundraising developments, but the startup is back at it, trying to convince developers to build tools with its AI models at its 2024 DevDay. The company announced several new tools Tuesday, including a public beta of its “Realtime API”, for building apps […]
